text: this is pretty basic and that hump is is
ugly the Bulge is weird
so Apple has a new battery case for the
iPhone 6 and 6s I've been using it for
the last few days and it's not very good
first the pros I think that the silicone
is nice it's got a you know decently
nice finish to it it's not too heavy
Apple's also made it to where it's one
piece so you can just kind of take it
off like so and slide the phone right
out which is pretty nice you can see the
batteries status on your phone on
Notification Center so you can see your
iPhone's battery and you can see the
cases battery it also lets you have
access to the headphone jack and the
Lightning port which a lot of other
cases don't sometimes you need to have
an adapter and that's really annoying
now the cons the hump on this thing is
is pretty weird you may have seen some
criticism on the internet recently for
it and I kind of don't understand why
Apple chose to make it look like this a
lot of other battery cases are just kind
of flush but honestly that's not my
biggest criticism it looks fine really
what I don't like about it is that when
you plug it in it just starts charging
automatically so you don't have the
ability to toggle it on or toggle it off
which pretty much every other battery
case lets you do with a physical button
on the side and I guess Apple design
team thought that a physical button was
too ugly or something so they didn't put
it on here also they made a really
bizarre design choice and put the only
physical battery indicator light on the
case inside the case
so when the case is on the phone you
can't see the light which is really
weird and doesn't make any sense it's
also just expensive this thing is a
hundred dollars so if you're looking for
a battery case or want to get one as a
gift I would not recommend apples I
would look at all of the others out
there Mophie is a really good brand they
have more features they'll charge the
phone longer
and they don't have this really
weird-looking home
